metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3916 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: The str_buf_cat function in string.c in Ruby 1.9.3, 2.0.0, and 2.1 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via a long string.

notes.Note: jdstrand> per Debian, only exploitable on Windows mdeslaur> we aren't going to release an update for this

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
ruby2.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
